title: Police say boy accidentally shot girl in the leg in West Valley
content:
WEST VALLEY CITY — A 16-year-old girl had injuries that were not life-threatening after she was accidentally shot in the leg Tuesday afternoon.
The girl was accidentally shot by a 16-year-old boy about 4:45 p.m., according to West Valley police spokeswoman Roxeanne Vainuku.The two were outside near 3200 South and 5100 West, Vainuku said.
The two teens reportedly knew each other. The boy stayed at the scene after the shooting and cooperated with detectives, police said.
Vainuku didn't immediately know the circumstances that led to the shooting. It wasn't clear early Tuesday evening whether the boy would be charged.
— Ben Lockhart, Brianna Bodily
